intro: Nototriche estipulata, commonly known as the stipulate nototriche, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Nototriche estipulata is often found in moist, open habitats and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
